FuncDef:
The ui-mode command enables the command output to be displayed in the user customized format.
The undo ui-mode command restores the default configuration.
By default, the function that displays command output in the user customized format is disabled.

ParaDef.Info:
Displays command output in type 2 format.
-

Displays command output in type 1 format.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the command is run, the command output is displayed in the user customized format.
Configuration Impact
After you configure the ui-mode type1 command, the output of the following commands is displayed in type 1 mode:
display ppp user-id. In the output of this command, the authentication phase is also displayed, and invalid fields are displayed as - or are not displayed.display ppp statistics interface. In the output of this command, statistics about sent and received Echo Reply packets are not displayed.display radius-server configuration. In the output of this command, the displayed RADIUS server status is UNKOWN during the detection when the device assumes that the RADIUS server is still Up. If the RADIUS server uses standard RADIUS, the protocol version displayed is radius standard.display traffic policy user-defined. In the output of this command, traffic classifier names and traffic behavior names are not displayed.
In addition, the AFTR attribute carried in the packets sent from the device to the clients is no longer obtained from the address pool.
If the ui-mode type2 command is run, the real-time user rates displayed in the outputs of the following commands are in kbit/s:
The display access-user command.The display access-user ip-address command.The display access-user ipv6-address command.The display access-user mac-address command.The display access-user user-id command.The display access-user verbose count command.The display access-user verbose nop command.

Precautions
If both the ui-mode type1 and ui-mode type2 commands are run, the latest configuration overrides the previous one, and no message is displayed.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
